bioghist.p: The Cromwells and Underhills were prominent Quaker families in New York. William Cromwell (1800-1871) married Caroline Underhill (1803-1848) in 1825. She was the daughter of Joshua and Mary Underhill. Their children included Alice Underhill Cromwell, who, in 1860, married Thomas Chase, professor of philology and classical literature, and second president of Haverford College (1875-1886); and James William Cromwell (b. 1842). Caroline Underhill's sister was Sarah F. Underhill (1798-1887).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of family papers of the Cromwell and Underhill families. Materials include: a Cromwell family tree and other genealogical records; the marriage certificates of Joshua Underhill and Mary Sutton (1789), and James Cromwell and Charlotte Hunt (1782); deeds; estate records of William and James Cromwell; diaries of Caroline Anna Cromwell (1849-1852) and Alice Cromwell (1854); an undated album of verse and illustrations kept by S.F. Underhill; school records and a scrapbook of letters and poems of Lincoln Cromwell; a history and genealogy of the Underhill family; and miscellaneous photographs and correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
